name: disputably
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is not certain and that some people might disagree with: A late goal was disputably ruled out for being offside. You may know that this city is home to, disputably, the best bagels in the world.
More examplesFewer examplesAt a time when disputably lesser achievements are given recognition, his modesty should not be ignored. The fact remains that there are many more people who are disputably old. They have disappeared from museums in favour of disputably more popular exhibits.
